explanation: The correct relationship requires recognizing angles forming a full circle sum to \(360\degree\). The student incorrectly calculated \(180\degree\), suggesting they applied the straight-line angle total to a circular arrangement. This indicates they conflated the angle measure of a semicircle (straight line) with a full rotation. The error occurs when interpreting the spatial relationship: they treated angles completing a circular path as if they formed a linear pair. This aligns specifically with confusing full-circle properties (360°) with linear ones (180°), not with errors about vertical angles or circle sectors. Related misconceptions about straight lines summing to 360° are contradicted here, as those would involve different spatial reasoning.
